body: @amrbashir excuse me, there still seems to be a problem with data-tauri-drag-region in my test. https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15380331/187820446-721f8517-622c-470a-b5e5-6106541049b6.mov but I can bypass it by **** EDIT： https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15380331/187822354-19a1879c-7300-4dc9-baa9-2dba0f18ce52.mov

@Moon1102 The drag attribute works only on the actual click target, which most of the times is the most inner element. This is by design because otherwise it would cause problems with buttons or other interact-able elements inside the drag area. You can confirm that this is the issue by trying to drag the window when it already has focus.

If it's the issue you basically just have to try adding the attribute to other elements and see what works for you, _or_ keep using the js api if it doesn't cause any problems :)
